website_summaries.verdict: The entry-level mirrorless OM-D E-M10 is another winner in Olympus' OM-D series. Its image quality, speedy performance, and built-in EVF earn it Editors' Choice honors.
pros: Good image quality at high ISO
cons: Lacks accessory port and mic input

customer_reviews.title: Great value, superior photos
customer_reviews.text: I was a diehard Nikon fan, but I didn't want to drag the larger, heavier equipment on my cruise. I fell in love with this camera on the trip. It is compact, lightweight, and takes excellent pictures!! It is much less expensive than comparable Nikons. I never thought I would say this, but buy Olympus - you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: LSeaborn

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: We love this camera. It is easy to use and takes super photos, but its small enough to fit in a coat pocket or small case. If you REALLY want to unlock its horsepower, spend some time watching videos and reading the manual — there's a lot of functionality under the hood. There are plenty of nice aftermarket lenses available. I recommend the Lumix 1:1.7/20 for day-to-day photos. I don't recommend this camera for someone with large, clumsy hands because the controls are pretty tight and small in an effort to squeeze everything in on the small camera body. And, buy some lens cap lanyards ... you're gonna wish you had some after you get the camera.
customer_reviews.author: MoonDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Even better than my EM-5
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a second body for my EM-5, it's a little smaller and lighter. It's also more sophisticated, if that's possible; so now the EM5 is the second body. The em-10 has a more flexible range of re-programming possibilities than the EM-5, same image quality, smaller and lighter. It does not take the same battery, unfortunately. Batteries last for about 2 hours. Now that it's been replaced by the EM-10 II, the older version is a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Kamuela

customer_reviews.title: What can I say - I love my camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say - I love my camera. It take great pics - it's relatively easy on the battery. I can take thousands of pics with a good SD card. I have all the controls I need to when I want - and it does a decent job of controlling the functions for me when I don't. I bought some nice glass for this - and I practice when I can... I've gotten some pretty stinking amazing pictures. Some that a lot of people think were taken by much more expensive 'professional' cameras. I'll let the pictures speak for themselves...
customer_reviews.author: Bradford

customer_reviews.title: perfect as a extra camera, or entry-level photographer.
customer_reviews.text: perfect for anyone who needs a lightweight camera with the features of a dslr for a fraction of the price. Throughout the recent years the mirrorless camera systems have been improving and taking over the market. This camera comes with a usable kit lens, not the best but at the same time far from the worse and in real life will be suitable for most people. I will keep this review short since there are plenty of reviews. it's a perfect combo for beginners, and i would highly recommend this as a camera to learn to grow into for a competitive price and a wide variety of lenses available.
customer_reviews.author: PenPixel

customer_reviews.title: This is one sweet camera.  Excellent for pictures, videos are awful, sound is worse.
customer_reviews.text: This is one sweet camera. Great for having all the buttons and knobs to adjust all the settings. View finder is superb. Typical Olympus, the menu system is more complicated than a space mission. If you are using this to take videos - forget it. The internal mics are awful (my x30 is far superior), and the videos are marginal at best. But for pictures, it is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. Once you get familiar with it, it's very easy to use. The photos I've taken so far have been great. I would recommend purchasing the Olympus adapter ring for the standard four thirds lenses. It's super light and almost cute because it's much smaller than you think, and that's okay. I got used to the smaller size very quickly. I attached a couple of the first pictures I took with it, fresh out of the box, in auto. Almost unbelievably, out of 16 million pixels, there are only 2 hot pixels. The video quality is excellent as is the stereo sound. I haven't tested the anti-wind setting yet for the audio, but I will soon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Broggie

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight wonder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to lighten my backpack when I travel. I had been carrying a Nikon D5100 with an 18-270 llens, so this is definitely a step in the "light" direction. I took both cameras on a trip to Yellowstone and Glacier this summer, and the Olympus performed just fine. I'm still learning to do some of fthe settings as the menus give so many options. It's not quite as simple and intuitive as the Nikon, but takes some fantastic photos. You can set it for Auto quite easily, but it will also let you toy with an amazing array of settings. I'm still learning, but the Nikon has been sold. I'm all in.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used. I wanted a second Olympus OMD EM10 camera body so that I do not have to switch lenses as frequently. I have already learned to use this model, so I ordered the same model to keep it simple.This arrived clean and very well protected. I recommend this camera. I use my camera for candid family photos (using zuiko 75-300mm lens), bird photography (300mm pro lens) and food pics (17mm lens). I am thrilled with this camera picture quality and ease of use after initial learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Just the facts

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but tricky
customer_reviews.text: This camera is beautiful and takes amazing pictures, however, it has an incredibly difficult interface that is not very user-friendly. I have had it almost a year and still struggle using the color feature, the very feature I bought the camera for. If you are starting out in photography like me, a simpler camera might be a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Grace H.

customer_reviews.title: Coming up from an EPM-1
customer_reviews.text: Just received my EM10 yesterday so I may or may not update. As the subject states, I'm moving up from my trusty epm1, which I loved and never missed the features of the more expensive ep3 and epl3 (at time of epm1 purchase) which at least partially explains why I went with the "poor man's em-1". Right off the bat, the 3axis IS is vastly improved over the epm1. I can shoot at ISO3600 and get usable photos whereas on my epm1 I couldn't really use over 1000. I know there's a new processor and it does seem significantly quicker and jpgs look terrific. I normally shoot RAW but jpgs are quicker/easier when they come out this well.
customer_reviews.author: pimpass

customer_reviews.title: this camera took great outdoor shots
customer_reviews.text: I'm a complete amateur in the world of photography, and after playing with my parent's Cannon DSLR I saved up enough to buy this gem. I travel a lot, and so I needed a camera that is light enough to be stashed in my backpack, but doesn't lose it's power. Although I'm a complete beginner, I started reading up on photography guides, and started with a basic kit and primer lens. So far, this camera took great outdoor shots, and with my new primer lens, indoor shoots are good too! Can't wait to discover more with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Boco

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I really like this camera. A new firmware is available which addresses a shutter vibration issue found in some Olympus MFT cameras. I haven't seen any review mention the problem existed in the E-M10 but it is still comforting to know Olympus is responsive to issues in their cameras. The camera itself has so many different adjustment options. It is going to take some time to become proficient with this camera. Image quality in my limited time is gorgeous. I would give this 4.5 stars taking a half star off only for the complicated menu system. Unfortunately, no 4.5 star option exists on the ratings.
customer_reviews.author: jhudgins

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a nice camera and well specd but the built ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a nice camera and well specd but the built in flash did not work. Reading online it seems to be a common issue. Had to return the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: I'm a beginner at photography but this camera is great! I really like how small the camera is ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner at photography but this camera is great! I really like how small the camera is and its weight. The photos that I've taken with this has surprisingly impressed me so I'm pretty happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Too small if you plan to use the 12-40mm 2.8. If you're using the kit lens or any of the primes then it is a fantastic size. Quality photos (for anything other than long exposure) and feature PACKED!
customer_reviews.author: James S. Yelverton

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loving this camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing "upgrade" from my older E-PL1. I already had two zoom lenses that work perfectly with this body. The extra 4MP enhances the captured images and the EVF provides an excellent eye-level view. There is also an incredible array of built-in features to provide easy manipulation for just about any type of shot one can imagine. This is a very useful photography tool in a compact and lightweight package.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBill

customer_reviews.title: Well satisfied
customer_reviews.text: A really nice camera with many nice features. So many features that I can't imagine using them all. Great photos. It feels like a well built camera and like all Olympuses (Olympi?) it is compact. I particularly like to 2x digital tele-converter. I'm sure the pricier models have additional features and are more rugged, but for an amateur, it is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: chipt

customer_reviews.title: Study and practice before you point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We are transitioning from point-and-shoot camera to one with a little more sophistication. Watched a lot of videos on the Olympus site and have done a lot of experimenting and trial and error. We are getting some great photos and look forward to further improvement in our photography. Sharp colors. Will need to get a zoom lens as it does not have that capability with the lens it comes with. Post processing is our next challenge.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!  ✨
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT!! This camera is so great!! It's my first camera but I really looked into which one I wanted and I can truly say I don't regret getting it at all! Plus it has the retro look which is prefect cause I love vintage!
customer_reviews.author: Dalia Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight option to full size DSLR's.
customer_reviews.text: I usually shoot with a D800e and a D7100. I bought this as a light travel camera. I was blown away by the image quality, especially with the sigma 19mm prime. I highly recommend this camera and it's not just for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: jpsassy65

customer_reviews.title: It's what I was looking for with slightly inconveniece.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still figuring out its full functions, but it's been good so far. I was looking for compact, inter-changeable, good quality (although not top quality) camera. I have three things to share with others. 1) battery dies quickly (I knew this issue from reviews before purchase) - better to buy second battery. 2) once battery dies, you need to input day/date/year again with new battery. 3) images tend to be slightly cold. (I may have not figured out full functions)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: The size is great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup for my OM-D E1 and now find myself using it almost exclusively. The built in flash makes it more convenient than putting the big flash on the E1. Not weather sealed but that is not usually important for my purposes. The size is great.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin R. Doering

customer_reviews.title: It is so light and fits great in my small hands
customer_reviews.text: Olympus OMD EM10 - I received this camera today and I am speechless. It is so light and fits great in my small hands. The performance is amazing and the looks incredible. I also ordered a grip which I highly recommend. I am very pleased with this camera. I also ordered the pancake 14-42 f3.5- 5.6 lens; the 45 f1.8, and the fisheye body cap lens f8. This system is really light weight an resembles so much a SLR. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little camera. Has a lot of nice features and at the same time is easy to carry around; so I take more pictures now compared to the time I was using a DSLR. I am also using my smartphone to take casual pictures, but when I need image quality, I use this camera as there is no comparison between the quality of the images coming out of this camera and my smartphone (even though my smartphone has the best in class camera). Instead of getting the standard 14-42mm lens, I got a prime 25mn 1.8mm lens and I am really happy I did that as the lens is very sharp and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ben. A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: This camera will give you DSLR quality images in a very compact package. Like all Olympus cameras, it has super-fast focusing, in-body image stabilization and an amazing lens selection. It is not weather sealed like the E-M5, but it has better buttons, built-in flash, focus peaking and Wi-Fi. Unless you absolutely need that weather sealing, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. The size is easy, yet the functionality of a DSLR. I bought it as a 2nd camera and have barely used my DSLR since. I've shot weddings, Sr. Pics and Family Photos. Plus, my favorite night photography. The view finder, size, design and Olympus reputation sold me on this camera and I haven't been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: clh

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and great service from Datavision
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the E-PM1 after I banged up the old camera during a fall. As soon as I attached my 12mm F2.0 lens and snapped the first couple photos I could tell the difference. I love the control with the dials and via the Olympus app on iPhone/iPad (great way for discreet street photography). Datavision was lightning fast in shipping the camera. I was worried at first because the camera was out of stock (pre-order) at all the other online stores. The Datavision shipment was totally legit and was a US spec model with the US plugs for the battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: but this is a great camera for someone who wants to step up from ...
customer_reviews.text: probably not going to cut it for a professional, but this is a great camera for someone who wants to step up from a cheap digital camera or a "high-end" cell phone camera. it takes really nice pictures and can probably do pro-quality stuff if you know what you're doing and maybe upgrade the lens. also the wi-fi features and mobile app are easy to use and really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: CB1

customer_reviews.title: what it was ment for
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST P/S CAMERA YOUCAN BUY.I ALWAYS BUY 2 love it...,.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great for Newbies
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a camera enthusiast, yet I found the OM-D E-M10 to be really easy to operate. It took excellent photographs. My wife and I LOVED the handheld starlight mode that takes 5 rapid succession photos and immediately processes them into one clear image; it enabled us to take fool-proof night-time photographs on our honeymoon in Italy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera for those that want a good camera but no huge price tag.
customer_reviews.text: It is an Amazing camera, not too complicated, light and nice design.WiFi Sync easy to set up (Remember that you need to connect on your Iphone to the Network created from your camera..).
customer_reviews.author: Philipe M

customer_reviews.title: I like the feel and size of it
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel and size of it. Photos are excellent quality. Like most digital cameras, it is complicated. So I am still trying to figure it out or trying to rediscover how I landed on a particular setting or menu--and I haven't even begun to venture from the Auto setting for shooting pics. I bought this as my first slr, so I am looking forward to venturing beyond point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: There are already many good reviews of this camera. I only want to add one thing - for $600 it was already a very good value. For $449 it is a steal. If you know that this is what you need, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ts

customer_reviews.title: little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: I love my little Olympus, especially its time lapse feature. Worked great for capturing the northern lights in Iceland, as well as overall nature shots
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: If you are new to photography and DSLR's are too expensive this is a good camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner and this camera has done very well, at least for me. I have no experience with a DSLR or any high end gear but this gets the job done. The detail in the pictures are great even with the included lens. Although I think it does lose a quite a bit of detail in low light but overall a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: Abradolf Lincler

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Level Camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is absolutely amazing. I am an amateur photographer and had many initial questions about the functioning of the camera. The seller was readily available for all of my pre-purchase questions. The camera has been working great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamel Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirrorless Camera
customer_reviews.text: This mirrorless Olympus camera is a great backup camera to my Nikon D800. The D800 is large and bulky. This camera is very compact. When traveling I take both cameras. I find myself using the Olympus more and more, since it is easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: RCK

customer_reviews.title: Solid little camera for daily use. I find myself ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid little camera for daily use. I find myself reaching to this over my other cameras nowadays. I purchased it to replace my old first gen Sony a55 - and it's been preforming well in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: He likes it a lot and share me a lot of great pictures because he travel a lot
customer_reviews.text: It is a gift for my father. He likes it a lot and share me a lot of great pictures because he travel a lot. Nice product. I always love Olympus!
customer_reviews.author: Jacklin S.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: It works well I have used it numerous times I like it for shooting from a aircraft
customer_reviews.author: Walter Vess Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in a compact DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and ease of use. I was previously leaving my larger DSLR home when on vacations due to sheer bulk. I took this baby to Italy and loved the results. The great results in tricky situations made me a fan.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gino

customer_reviews.title: I'm a long time Olympus PEN and OMD user and this is my favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying this camera quite a bit. I'm a long time Olympus PEN and OMD user and this is my favorite so far. It may not have all of the features of the top of the line OMD's but I'm not missing them. This camera is very similar to my OMD- EM5 which my fiance "liberated" from me and I enjoy shooting with it just as much. The image quality is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Love this small
customer_reviews.text: Love this small, compact camera. Lives up to DSLRs. I have been taking lessons with a professional photographer and even he said it is a very sophisticated camera. If you are upgrading from a point-and-shoot, this has everything you could want or need. I'm still learning about some of the more advanced settings (like multiple exposure) but I have been thrilled with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Irish Rose

customer_reviews.title: And I'll have to be careful not to get a bad case of lens fever
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this - neat and well-designed in a surprisingly compact format (compared to my old Minolta SRT I used as a kid). This will get me into photography again. I'm looking forward to using this on future travels. And I'll have to be careful not to get a bad case of lens fever!
customer_reviews.author: gabe

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Was looking for something that takes decent ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Was looking for something that takes decent photos for vacations and family events. This is way better than I needed and cheaper than most I found. Would recommend this for anyone who wants good camera for everyday use, or someone who needs a backup for a professional operation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: need more battery
customer_reviews.text: international version. perfect picture,easy to use. but the battery is easy to used out (about 300 pictures), two or more batteries should be prepared during tour. You had better use a mirrorless camera bag to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so fun to use! Very friendly, easy to understand its settings. Beautifully retro, very comfortable and light. The only problem for me is the Wifi image transfer, since the mobile app is very bad and outdated.
customer_reviews.author: Paula B.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Very small and has a lot of features and takes great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: This a fine little camera. It can be customized for your shooting style. IQ is as good as the EM1, but lacks weather sealing.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred R. Marzian

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera was very easy to figure out how to use. Very user friendly, and takes excellent pictures. This is my go to travel camera, because of picture quality and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Radley

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat photos and weddings
customer_reviews.text: The wifi feature on this camera allowed me to text some great wedding photos to my family immediately after taking them! I also bought a portrait lens which I used to take that picture of my sister's cat, Sherman.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adapt old school glass with pinpoint accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I just got an open box e m10 body. It is an amazingly customizable photography tool. The new standard in portable slr tech. Easy to adapt old school glass with pinpoint accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist69

customer_reviews.title: small but packed with options and quality
customer_reviews.text: Smart looking camera! The quality of the pictures that took with the lens are quite good.
customer_reviews.author: tech dude

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality CSC Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality and features for the price! Looking forward to more deals from this vendor!
customer_reviews.author: Andy H.

customer_reviews.title: Pro like Photo quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes almost professional photos and is smaller and lighter then most pro cameras. Perfect for wifey that likes to take photos without carrying the bulk!
customer_reviews.author: H. C.

customer_reviews.title: Say Cheese
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife for Christmas, who's getting into photography as a hobby. She was thrilled to receive it. This camera take phenomenal photos right out of the box, but has plenty of features with with she can hone her craft over time. Intuitive controls, beautiful retro design.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Very, very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just absolutely mesmerized by what this little camera can do. I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mayet

customer_reviews.title: Smoothie
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera... I have found that it is more sensitive in dim lighting, the lack of the mirror gives a smoother action when taking photos. The instructional DVD for this camera is most helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Janice J

customer_reviews.title: Omd EM10 ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: Camera is fantastic. It takes photos as good as 2X costing EM1 which I also own. Leaving curve much easier too. I like the pop up flash.
customer_reviews.author: Robert c gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought into the OM-D system for the 75-300mm zoom as a compact wildlife outfit. The E-M10 is an excellent camera with every kind of fine tuning option you could need... But simple enough on the surface to be easy to use. Extremely well made as well. Image quality is a step above my Canon bridge camera but not quite as good as my Sony NEX. About what I expected. All in all I am very happy with it, and the 75-300mm is working well for Wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ingraham

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Camera
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional camera. For those who want a compact, light, highly portable interchangeable lens camera, this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be advised Olympus is selling this great camera for five days starting 11/26 for $399
customer_reviews.author: Ctman2

customer_reviews.title: Really good camera. i took it on my trips over ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good camera. i took it on my trips over seas and took some amazing shots. I am not a professional photographer so this camera helped in making my shots better.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Alam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great camera to start getting in to photography. the lens that comes with it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, looks and feels like an old film camera. It takes great pictures and is the perfect size, it is so much more subtle than a DSLR . You have control of all sorts of settings, for both the novice and advanced photographer.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something lighter to.tote around than my Canon 6D. I bought this and the 45mm 1.8 lens. I was not disappointed. I am simply amazed at how well.this tiny camera does.
customer_reviews.author: paige.lyon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One nice camera for the money, easy to use, great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still amazed at how they get it all into such a ...
customer_reviews.text: Owned an E500 and an E-P1. Olympus is always feature loaded for price. The features in this one are extensive. Still amazed at how they get it all into such a small handful.
customer_reviews.author: F. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice DLSR for its price
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade to a new mirrorless DSLR. This really has lots of new things to learn and use. Its more entry level but still does a whole lot.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S. King

customer_reviews.title: so good. Took some fiddling to get the settings right ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Took some fiddling to get the settings right for our images. Images processed in Lightroom give very nice results. We like the compact size and easy handling so we find it easy to take it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: best camera... take amazing pictures & is really light and small. love it
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Leandro Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this camera. I looked at several more expensive models, but glad I went with this one. Easy to use as a beginner, pictures are fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: monkeyb420

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, is easy to use and take great photos
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: but I have used it for 2 weeks and really enjoy shooting photos with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning all the things this camera can do, but I have used it for 2 weeks and really enjoy shooting photos with it. The pictures look amazing and it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with the quality and functionality of this camera paired with the new Olympus 25mm lens. I have used enthusiast level Canon DSLR gear for years, but ended up leaving the camera behind more times than not because of the bulk. I'm really impressed with what Olympus has been able to do with such a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with my purchase. This camera is perfect for beginners, so I've learned a lot in playing around with it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera, the pictures it takes are beautiful and its easy to understand for beginers like myself. I totally recomend it
customer_reviews.author: Anahi

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera for a beginning photographer. I know almost nothing about photography but I am able to take very nice pictures with this camera. It is simple to use after reading through the instructions and it looks nice too. The battery life is sufficient; I have never had the battery die while using it. I especially like being able to use a viewfinder, which is something that many new cameras do not come with. It is a digital viewfinder, but it works well. I also use the wifi feature on it to connect with the iPhone app and download the pictures to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little camera.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my Olympus E-PL1 that still works very well. The difference in 5 years of technology advancement is astounding. Hence, my rating. I paired this with a 32GB Sandisk Extreme, and in continuous mode, it filled 10GB without slowing down. The integrated electronic viewfinder is great, bright, clear, and if I don't look for pixels, it feels like optical. The hump makes it just a little taller my old E-PL1 but it's delightfully smaller. It is still too big to pocket comfortably, but with lenses I use, I won't be able to pocket it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Christmas gift for a friend it is a really nice
customer_reviews.text: Camera was a Christmas gift for a friend it is a really nice camra
customer_reviews.author: Sherry l. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and speedy delivery...good for everything just takes time to figure everything it does!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, very easy to use, light and easy to carry, perfect for work or for leisure
customer_reviews.author: Francine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good and portable camera . Not heavy . Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Gave it as a gift to my son and now I want one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The search for a high quality camera ends here!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I scoured the internet for a new camera for what seemed like an eternity. We wanted something that was compact, light and took high quality images. We must have considered 20 or so different models and various brands before, eventually, taking the plunge with the OM-D-EM10. We could not be more delighted with it. It takes phenomenal photos in all sorts of environments with minimal fuss and effort. It oozes quality and, honestly, it takes better photographs than the old Canon DSLR I used whilst working as a photojournalist in Montana. The only gripe I have with the OM-D-EM10 is a relatively small one -- I just wished I bought it a lot sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: J A Cooksey

customer_reviews.title: My first 50 pictures are good. I'm getting more familiar with the camera every ...
customer_reviews.text: My first 50 pictures are good. I'm getting more familiar with the camera every week. I still have to initiate some of the features, but am looking forward to more quality photography.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs - I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it - Small camera that I can bring anywhere together with my 12-40mm f2.8 Olympus PRO lense and a portrait lense sigma 60mm f2,8, - I can use a very small bag. for a beginner like me this is my step up from the E-PM series, I did a lot of research and what I got is exactly what I need. I won't take full advantage of the OMD-EM1 or 5 so I don't need to spend the extra $$$ for it. Maybe in the future, for now this is a great camera for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Campos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel option
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully designed and handles very well. I purchased after shooting Canon 5D III and Sony A7 nearly exclusively for years and find the portability of the Olympus to be a very welcomed feature. You can't expect the same image quality but this camera certainly holds its own. The JPEGs are really nice at low ISO but the noise reduction is, in my opinion, a bit strong. I shoot RAW mostly and find that it does 95% of what I want it to do. You can't take a picture if the camera isn't with you. This camera is very compact and fits in very convenient places.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I am truly enjoying this great lightweight and powerful camera
customer_reviews.text: FOLLOW UP 23018: Still very much enjoying this camera. ---I am truly enjoying this great lightweight and powerful camera. It reminds me of my first 35mm camera which was an Olympus oh M1 back in 1970 something. It's lightweight small and yet takes wonderful pictures. It has a multitude of settings and interchangeable lenses. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: TR Dunne

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: it is exactly what I needed to take pictures of my grandsons playing soccer
customer_reviews.author: j Michael Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile camera at a good price. Many features to learn about. Good value!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Wonderful!  Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera! Olympus quality shines in the EM10. The retro styling to the old OM-2 series from the 1970's is right on! (excuse the pun) Excellent pics and great low light results! Can't go wrong. So many features that it will take lots of practice and patience to learn them all.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby49

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Pics are amazing
customer_reviews.text: The camera I was waiting for years to replace my slr. Love it! Pics are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Szilagyi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted. Small compared to my DSLR and light. Also I have found that ,with an adaptor, There are a ton of vintage lenses that can be had for a song. They are a little heftier than the modern lenses but if your frugal, like me, then they are a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Melvyn Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera. The pictures it takes are on par with an entry DSLR in a much smaller package. It's so light I barely notice it when I have it around my neck or shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little camera. Got for my daughter who is shooting merchandise, models, and some landscape. Way more features than she knows how to use but hopefully she will explore and learn. But, even on auto, results are very good. Paired with Olympus 17mm f1.8 and Olympus 40-150.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Croxford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it long enough to give it 5 stars but so far it is amazing! I got it for Christmas and have been using it for my photography class. It takes beautiful pictures and it's easy to use once you get the hang of it. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mazie

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have the camera since December 2014. I love it!!! It is more than I have expected. However, all depends on your personal taste, needs and preferences. This camera is a replacement for my Nikon D40. Fit and finish is is first rate. Speed, functions, and ergonomics - awesome. I have large hands and have no problems handling this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Small, lightweight, powerful
customer_reviews.text: The only significant feature I feel is missing from this camera is the ability to have focus peaking while shooting video. Still, it's an absolutely fantastic camera for the money. The quality of the photos and video are outstanding. The 3-axis stabilization is especially handy for video, especially when using fast prime and legacy lenses.
customer_reviews.author: JT

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Black)- Body only
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Body only| Configuration:BaseThe new E-M10 boasts a powerful TruePic VII image processor, a large, interactive electronic viewfinder, built-in flash and Wi-Fi, a warp-speed AF system that allows sequential shooting at 8fps (yes, eight!), and much more. The sensor, image processor and lens technology are the core of any digital camera. The E-M10 ups the ante by pairing a 16MP Live MOS sensor with our most powerful TruePic VII image processor for extraordinary resolution and accurate color rendition. The OM-D E-M10"s partner in photographic excellence is the acclaimed Olympus M.ZUIKO lens system, a family of professional-grade glass with digital optics that delivers unsurpassed resolution and overall image quality. Add 3-axis in-body image stabilization that compensates for horizontal and vertical angular shifts as well as rolling, and you have a camera that captures incredibly sharp images and video, yet is compact enough to bring just about anywhere. 

Use this comparison chart to compare all of the Olympus OM line.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



BUILT TO A HIGHER STANDARD.
The E-M10 boasts a powerful TruePic™ VII image processor, a large, interactive electronic viewfinder, built-in flash and WiFi, a warp-speed AF system that allows sequential shooting at 8fps (yes, eight!), and much more. So ditch the bulky DSLR and lighten up with the E-M10.

Unprecedented Image Quality That Exceeds Others in its Class
The lens technology, sensor and image processor are the core of any digital camera. The OM-D E-M10’s partner in photographic excellence is the acclaimed Olympus M.ZUIKO lens system, a family of professional-grade glass that delivers unsurpassed resolution and overall image quality. The E-M10 ups the ante by pairing a 16MP Live MOS sensor with our most powerful TruePic VII image processor for extraordinary resolution and accurate color rendition. Add 3-axis in-body image stabilization that compensates for horizontal and vertical angular shifts (yaw/pitch) as well as camera shake along the optical axis (roll), and you have a camera that captures incredibly sharp images and video, yet is compact enough to bring just about anywhere.

Lens Options and Flashes for Every Conceivable Shooting Situation 
Only Olympus offers such a wide array of portable, professional grade lenses. You can choose from no less than 17 Micro Four Third M.ZUIKO lenses -- an impressive assortment of fast primes, telephoto zooms and macros - to support your unique photographic style. A number of versatile external flashes (with wireless remote control capabilities) also play well with the E-M10 for situations that require additional lighting.

Design That Blends Classic Cool and Modern Performance
We believe that a go-anywhere camera designed for avid photographers should feel and look solid. That’s why we built the E-M10’s slim, elegant body out of metal, and tricked it out with meticulously engineered metal parts. (The 2x2 dial controls are particularly sweet!) The E-M10 just feels right, substantial yet perfectly balanced. It’s only fitting that a beautiful camera like this takes such beautiful photos.

Keep Your Eye on the Prize with the E-M10’s Large, Easy-to-See EVF
Shooting at eye level is comfortably familiar. And when you get a live view of exposure, white balance and other useful information, and the ability to control highlights, shadows, colors and more – as you do with the E-M10’s electronic viewfinder – you’re in position to take some of the best photos of your life. You can also apply various framing grids and a leveling guide for composing better photos and even monitor video recording!

The high-res EVF (1.44 million pixels) provides 1.15x magnification, double-speed 120fps refresh rate and adaptive brightness technology, which automatically adjusts brightness to the optimum setting for a more natural display.

A Wealth of Built-In Features
The E-M10 is a marvel of thoughtful design and useful functionality. Built-in Wi-Fi for easy image sharing and wireless control, built-in flash for filling in the shadows and numerous creative tools, tiltable LCD monitor with touch screen - there's more, but we don't have to do into all the impressive details here! It's not what you'd call inexpensive, but the value is clear.

Life Moves Fast…and the E-M10 is Designed to Keep Pace
You might want to wear your running shoes when using the E-M10. High-speed sequential shooting – at a best-in-class 8fps – and super high-speed FAST AF technology ensure that you won’t miss the shot no matter how quickly your subject is moving. In fact, the autofocus tracking function is better than ever thanks to enhancements to the group target Continuous AF function. The E-M10 also provides an 81-point AF grid that covers the entire image frame, giving you more focus options than basic DSLRs.

With So Many Creative Tools, Finding the Shot Is Only the Beginning
Focus peaking in manual focus mode. Color Creator. HDR and HDR bracketing. Twelve Art Filters and nine Art Effects. Photo Story (including a new Zoom In/Out theme). Photo and Movie Capture (high-quality stills while shooting a movie – at an insane 5fps in P/A/S/M mode). Live Composite Mode for capturing starscapes intuitively. The E-M10 offers you an incredible array of easy-to-use creative tools that can transform your photos from excellent to spectacular.


SEE HOW THE OLYMPUS OM-D FAMILY COMPARES
